Class SynchronizedBuffer

java.lang.Object
SynchronizedBuffer
public class SynchronizedBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
This class is responsible for implementing the shared buffer objects that will be used as a means to pass information between the various nodes in the program.
Since:
10/12/2021
Author:
Tucker Dickson

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.util.concurrent.ArrayBlockingQueue<java.lang.String[]> buffer
    This private ArrayBlockingQueue object represents the buffer that two nodes will use to communicate.
    private boolean occupied
    This private boolean indicates whether this buffer is currently occupied (it contains a value).

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    SynchronizedBuffer()
    This is the sole constructor for the SynchronizedBuffer class.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    java.lang.String[] blockingGet()
    This method will be ud to a "consumer" node to receive an order from a shared buffer.
    void blockingPut​(java.lang.String[] data)
    This method will be used by a "producer" node to send an order into a shared buffer.
    boolean isOccupied()
    This method checks to see if this buffer is "occupied" (i.e.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • buffer

      private java.util.concurrent.ArrayBlockingQueue<java.lang.String[]> buffer
      This private ArrayBlockingQueue object represents the buffer that two nodes will use to communicate.

    • occupied

      private boolean occupied
      This private boolean indicates whether this buffer is currently occupied (it contains a value).

  • Constructor Details

    • SynchronizedBuffer

      public SynchronizedBuffer()
      This is the sole constructor for the SynchronizedBuffer class. It doesn't take any parameters, and it initializes buffer to a new ArrayBlockingQueue that takes arrays of Strings (with a capacity of one) and occupied to false.

  • Method Details

    • blockingPut

      public void blockingPut​(java.lang.String[] data) throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      This method will be used by a "producer" node to send an order into a shared buffer.
      Parameters:
      data - This array of Strings refers to an individual order being put into a shared buffer.
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - This exception will be thrown in the case that a thread is interrupted.

    • blockingGet

      public java.lang.String[] blockingGet() throws java.lang.InterruptedException
      This method will be ud to a "consumer" node to receive an order from a shared buffer.
      Returns:
      This method returns an array of Strings referring to an individual order.
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - This exception will be thrown in the case that a thread is interrupted

    • isOccupied

      public boolean isOccupied()
      This method checks to see if this buffer is "occupied" (i.e. it contains an object). If it is, the method returns true, otherwise it returns false.
      Returns:
      This method returns a boolean value indicating whether a buffer is occupied at the moment.
